channel.title: 🔥 Open Data hot twitter posts | by onData
channel.description: Tweets about open data, which have received at least 10 hearts or retweets, in many languages

item.title: #es @ 1515486380243263488
item.description:
Los altos niveles de inmunidad comunitaria frente a una infección previa de #Omicron proporcionan una buena protección frente a todas las nuevas variantes de #Omicron
Las hospitalizaciones y muertes en Sudáfrica están en sus mínimos históricos
Ídem en el Perú
#DatosAbiertos https://t.co/50nGysw8kX

item.title: #fr @ 1515272068715225094
item.description: Tellement soulé par ces "les jeux de baston sont trop durs". On a des données publiques et des témoignages de devs qui prouvent qu'ajouter des tutoriels ou réduire la complexité ne change rien. C'est surtout une question d'attractivité et de marketing qui fait le succès des jeux.

item.description: (أخبار الردة) كتاب مفقود صنفه: وثيمة بن موسى بن الفرات الفارسي الفسوي ت٢٣٧هـ ذكره ووصفه ابن خلكان في (الوفيات ج.٦: ١٢)، ونقل عنه الحافظ ابن حجر العسقلاني ١١٠ نصا في (الإصابة). جمعها ودرسها: المستشرق الألماني ولهلم هونرباخ (Wilhelm Hoenerbach) (١٩١١-١٩٩١م). https://t.co/ZwECU98cLh https://t.co/dFZEOzxnOh

item.description:
I am actively working on researching and organizing ways to fix this problem. You can find my writings at
https://t.co/O8WqeRTmCD
Which will soon be collected as a book. I'm also working on a research grant to build tools and open data that can help pro-housing municipalities

item.title: #es @ 1515007881795493894
item.description:
Sigue acercándose a CERO📉
#LoUltimo La Villa Panamericana registra 17 pacientes hospitalizados por #COVID19 : La más baja tras 70 semanas desde el 12/12/2020
Tal cantidad representa una reducción del 99% de la máxima ocupación de 2,158 del 19/01/2022
#DatosAbiertos SUSALUD

Pero está prohibido. https://t.co/ijgUpbMQoW

Twitter master plan:

item.title: #en @ 1514661756332822535
item.description: On Thu 21st April, I will join an interesting debate on #OpenData being Risky or Beneficial? at the 2nd Roundtable organised by @gatherhub_ As the world technologically grows, we’ll look into who benefits from open #data and which communities and people it can pose a risk for? https://t.co/2AA5aKDxfe

item.title: #en @ 1514649432788197380
item.description: Does anybody have any resources to suggest on what variables are necessary to remove before posting open data to a repository? Obviously contact information but I've heard others that weren't as common sense to me (e.g., birthdates, disease history, etc) #OpenScience

Tickets are $15, lunch incl. Msg me if ur a student or can't afford the fee.
https://t.co/Xa1qvJrOUu https://t.co/42JlkFGD7x

item.title: #en @ 1514640493325344772
item.description: If you think #opendata is fair, think again. When it comes to measuring tropical forests, hard-won data made open doesn’t reduce inequalities in science, instead it can increase them. Those who benefit from #opendata are often in privileged situations 💭 https://t.co/1pxue5A9NZ

Ready when you are.

item.description: Et comme d'habitude, ça chouine parce que c'est livré brut (c'est le principe de l'#OpenData) sans interface clicodrome. item.title: #en @ 1514431799409225731
item.description: (3/8) So, when I read an article that expounds on the virtues of open-access data, but then says they used data from two big open-data sources without courtesy of citation, I can’t help but wonder exactly how committed those authors are to truly open and respectful science:

item.title: #en @ 1514431798423572486
item.description: 2/8 This is particularly important for open-data projects, b/c some people still don’t place as high a value in such work as they do in traditional print media. (Witness failure to cite them!) They are also one of the few ways of justifying this kind of work to funding agencies.

item.title: #en @ 1514276073751474178
item.description: This week in Bias in #Archaeology we discussed #OpenScience & #OpenData. We began by telling participants that they had been given an important trove of data… on a hard disk, Zip disk or DVD, & asked how they would to retrieve it. #anthrotwitter #anthropology (1/5) https://t.co/EWmdCiEk7F

item.description: @TheMorgenroth I have some open data (testimony about guilty pleasures) here: https://t.co/tIfttP1vRc Feel free to go through it. I love the testimony of the man describing "Desperate Housewives" as his guilty pleasure, because he is "a manly man".
